Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. No
substantial violations were found.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager Samantha Way at (517) 243-9743.
Sincerely,
Heather Reilly, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Privacy safeguard
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12211
Section (1) An agency shall safeguard the privacy of a child and his or her
Description family.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Foster care worker shared confidential case information with
significant other for an unknown time period.
Investigation On 3/27/24 Complainant reported to Department of Child Welfare
Licensing (DCWL) that Foster Care Worker (FCW) discussed her
cases “openly and in detail”. Complainant made additional
allegations against FCW regarding incidents that occurred during
their personal relationship. Complainant was advised via email on
3/27/24 that those concerns did not fall under the regulatory scope
of DCWL. However, a breach of confidentiality would be
investigated. Complainant was asked to provide additional
information about any specific case information that was
discussed openly. Complainant responded on 4/8/24 but did not
provide any information about the cases. Complainant continued
to provide information about their personal relationship with FCW,
which was not relevant to the allegation. On 4/11/24 Complainant
was contacted via email and asked to provide names or case
details that FCW shared openly. On 4/11/24 Complainant
responded with additional information about their personal
relationship with FCW but did not provide any case information or
evidence to support the allegation.
Foster Care Worker was interviewed by phone on 3/27/24.
FCW initially contacted DCWL by email on 3/27/24 to report
Complainant had contacted her. FCW provided a screen shot of a
text she received from Complainant. The screen shot was of the
email that DCWL sent to Complainant asking for additional
information. In the text, Complainant indicated he would turn FCW
in if she did not give him what he wanted.
2

FCW reported she was in a long-term relationship with
Complainant, which recently ended. This is not the first time
Complainant told FCW they would get her fired unless she
resumed their relationship. FCW reported she was in the process
of obtaining a Personal Protection Order due to some recent
incidents with Complainant. FCW reported Complainant had been
making threats towards her for a very long time. FCW indicated
the relationship ended a few months ago, and unlike other times,
she has refused to resume the relationship. Which is what she
believed escalated Complainant’s behavior. FCW was concerned
about how this investigation would impact her job. FCW stated
that prior to this incident, she spoke with her current supervisor
and two previous supervisors regarding the ongoing issues with
Complainant.
Regarding the allegation, FCW stated she never shared case
information with anyone, including Complainant. As FCW and
Complainant lived together, it was possible he overheard her on
some phone calls. However, FCW always took calls in another
room and used headphones. Therefore, any information he
overheard was a one-sided conversation and not intentional. FCW
reported she had two clients that went to high school with
Complainant. FCW never discussed these clients with
Complainant, but he knew about their cases through mutual
friends.
Supervisor was interviewed via video call on 4/12/24.
Supervisor reported she has been the manager for FCW since
September 2023. Supervisor reported there was no disciplinary
action on file regarding FCW. Supervisor also reported she did not
have any concerns of FCW sharing confidential case information,
nor had she received any complaints from clients. Supervisor
verified that she has observed threatening personal emails that
Complainant had sent to FCW. Supervisor was aware of the
ongoing struggles FCW had with Complainant and indicated he
tried to control her by making threats to call her boss and get her
in trouble. However, Complainant has never called Supervisor.
Previous Supervisor 1 (PS1) answered interview questions
via email on 4/15/24. PS1 reported she supervised FCW from
2018-2022. PS1 never had any concerns of FCW sharing
confidential information. PS1 was aware of Complainant making
threats toward FCW during that time. FCW spoke with PS1 about
Complainant making threats that he would do something to make
her lose her job. However, PS1 never received allegations from
anyone.
3

Previous Supervisor 2 (PS2) answered interview questions
via email on 4/15/24. PS2 reported she supervised FCW from
May 2022 through September 2023. PS2 never had concerns of
FCW sharing confidential information. PS2 reported they were
aware of Complainant making threats that he would do something
to make FCW lose her job. PS2 never received allegations from
anyone.
Documents reviewed:
Personal Protection Order against complainant granted 4/2/24.
Analysis As there was no evidence provided by the complainant of case
specific information being shared in public, no violation was found.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
_ ______________April 17, 2024_______________________
Heather A Reilly Date
